title: font id help link updated
content:
Does anyone know what this font is? The closest I’ve found is Accelerator by Verkaart and P22 Basala, but neither of them are exactly right. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks for looking and letting me know it didn’t upload. I’m looking for the font on the logo at this link: [http://eteamz.active.com/checkers94/index.cfm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/eteamz.active.com/checkers94/index.cfm "http://eteamz.active.com/checkers94/index.cfm")?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [drupal](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/typophile.com/files/drupal_76) | 33.46 KB |

 [‹ Type ID Pop Quiz V2.0](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/typophile.com/node/15787 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Variation of Helvetica? - Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/typophile.com/node/16430 "Go to next forum topic")
author: figrsk8r

comments.content:
(I can’t get access to the image, so I’m basing my answer on the logo of this site [http://drupal.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/drupal.org/ "http://drupal.org/"))

Maybe [FF Daxline](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=28&displayfontid=FF.11491.0.0&fontRendererText=Drupal) ?

Wait, I take it back.  
It’s [FF Max Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119130921/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11395.5.25&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Drupal&sampleSize=48) afterall :^D

eheheh, i’ve just realised that all the attachments on Typophile are named ’drupal’ :^)  
so, forget that id :^P
